title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {octopusR: Package for interacting with the Octopus Energy API},   author = {James McMahon},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/Moohan/octopusR, https://moohan.github.io/octopusR/}, }

what: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: Return list consumption values half-hour periods given meter-point meter. Unit measurement: Electricity meters: kWh SMETS1 Secure gas meters: kWh SMETS2 gas meters: m^3

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
code: get_consumption(   meter_type = c("electricity", "gas"),   mpan_mprn = get_meter_details(meter_type)[["mpan_mprn"]],   serial_number = get_meter_details(meter_type)[["serial_number"]],   api_key = get_api_key(),   period_from = NULL,   period_to = NULL,   page_size = 100L,   order_by = c("-period", "period"),   group_by = c("hour", "day", "week", "month", "quarter") )

title: List consumption for a meter — get_consumption
text: meter_type Type meter-point, electricity gas mpan_mprn electricity meter-point's MPAN gas meter-point’s MPRN. serial_number meter's serial number. api_key API key. Octopus Energy customer, can generate API key online dashboard. period_from Show consumption given datetime (inclusive). parameter can provided . period_to Show consumption given datetime (exclusive). parameter also requires providing period_from parameter create range. page_size Page size returned results. Default 100, maximum 25,000 give full year half-hourly consumption details. order_by Ordering results returned. Default results returned reverse order latest available figure. Valid values: period, give results ordered forward. -period, (default), give results ordered recent backwards. group_by Aggregates consumption specified time period. day considered start end midnight server's timezone. default consumption returned half-hour periods. Accepted values : hour day week month quarter
